poem:
**Loss in the Boot**

The songbird's words—  
jotted in ink,  
notes fluttered away  
in a thieving breeze.  
  
A car stolen  
swallowed dreams,  
yet hope rests  
in the heart's backseat.  
  
Raye finds rhythm—  
grief's quiet tune  
whispers renewal  
from the echo,  
still humming.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Raye loses songwriting books for second album in car theft The chart-topping British singer-songwriter Raye has said that her second album will be delayed after songs for it were stolen along with her car. She wrote on Instagram: “My car got stolen with all my song writing books in the boot so no second album any time soon love you bye.” It’s a frustrating setback for the singer, born Rachel Keen, who built considerable momentum". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Raye loses songwriting books for second album in car theft The chart-topping British singer-songwriter Raye has said that her second album will be delayed after songs for it were stolen along with her car.
